column2: The position heads Finance, Accounts and Taxation. S/he is responsible for ensuring compliance of all the above functions to meet corporate guidelines and adhere to all external compliance requirements of the Government, Auditors and lending agencies. Coordinate the preparation of financial statements, financial reports, special analyses and information reports. column2: ROLE OVERVIEW:      This position reports to the Division Manager of US/ Canada & Europe Division. The RM will nurture existing and develop new business opportunities within the assigned European region towards consistently increasing sales as well as forging sustainable and mutually beneficial relationships. Participate in the overall success of GrainPro through contribution in various activities that increase company awareness in the agriculture sector as well as other related sectors such as but not limited to, financing, fumigation, and storage.     Additionally, this position will be essential in increasing demand at a global level from the approach to buyers and multinational companies located in Europe. With this role, there is an exciting opportunity to implement new ideas, processes and actions in parallel to corporate and divisional strategy with the aim of increasing sales, brand awareness and market share in different industries.       KEY RESPONSIBILITES:       Sales and Marketing          Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the company, its strategy, and objectives as well as its product offering.           Proficient knowledge of the end-to-end agriculture market in the European Union region (and near countries such as the UK, Switzerland, Norway and Russia) and associated trade processes.            Ability to identify marketing strategies for the different agriculture market players with potential need of company products.           Existing relationships in the agriculture sector specifically the leading food and food commodity sub-sectors with the highest potential of adopting company products such as coffee, cocoa, organic companies and/ or multinational companies located in the region to develop.            Ability to interact closely with existing and potential customers key decision makers towards informing their investment decisions and advising on solutions for the agricultural needs in our products.           Ensure the success of projects implemented within the region adhering to GrainPro s quality delivery standards, leading to incremental sales.        Customer Service          Assist new customers with their onboarding process and understanding the solutions they might need.           Understand and communicate how the GrainPro technology works and what are the benefits for their operations.            Coordinate new orders and inventory with the actual warehouse service and the other GrainPro Divisions and Production facility.            Evaluate the Key Accounts and Distributor opportunities needs within the job region.            Share feedback to the Logistics/ Supply Chain, Engineering, HR, Finance and Sales departments through the proper communication channels in order to improve the global company operations.           Understand the different customer profiles in the industry and adapt to their different needs.           Actively use the HubSpot CRM system in order to create reports and have data for operation improvements.         Finance          Responsible for the profitability of the region in charge.            Liaise with GrainPro US/ EU finance director and Division Manager to ensure the activities within the region are included in the overall budget.            Monitor region s budget utilization against sales delivered monthly and provide rational for deviation as well as savings quarterly.           Accounts Receivable for the region.           Ensure that sales and expense transactions are properly supported, compliant with regulations and accurately reported.           Use of NetSuite accounting software with the company guidelines and procedures.        REQUIREMENTS:          Ability to manage time effectively, work independently and be self-motivated           Very detail-oriented, and meticulous and highly analytical           A fundamental desire to continuously learn.           Teamwork skills.           Minimum 2+ years experience in sales and marketing area or relevant years of experience in sales in the agriculture sector, food industry or other relevant sector.           Experience in project management would be desirable.            Business-level English is required.           Strong ethical background is required.
column13: Food Industry, Sales, Accounting, Key Accounts, Finance, Accounts Receivable, New Business, Supply Chain, Marketing, Logistics

column2: A Senior Accountant Executive is a high-level accounting professional responsible for managing the financial operations of an organization. They oversee financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis, as well as the management of accounting staff.      Budgeting and Forecasting: Developing and managing budgets and financial forecasts, including identifying potential risks and opportunities.      Financial Analysis: Analyzing financial data to identify trends and patterns, and making recommendations for improving financial performance.      Accounting Management: Managing accounting staff and ensuring that financial transactions are recorded accurately and in a timely manner.      Compliance: Ensuring compliance with relevant accounting standards, regulations, and laws.      Auditing: Coordinating with internal and external auditors to ensure the accuracy of financial statements and compliance with audit requirements.      Process Improvement: Continuously reviewing and improving accounting processes and procedures to increase efficiency and accuracy.      Industry: Originating,Processing & Marketing Agro-commodities & food products, with a focus on Spices, Oil Seeds, Pulses, Cereals, Feeds, Herbs & Botanicals, Raisins and Foodstuffs.

column2: Role & responsibilities Provide technical expertise and guidance on fisheries management, aquaculture, and related activities to support the FFPO project. Conduct  assessments  and  surveys  to  identify  opportunities  and  challenges  in  the fisheries  sector,  including  market  demand,  production  constraints,  and  resource availability. Develop and implement training programs and capacity-building initiatives for fisherfolk members of the FFPO, focusing on best practices in aquaculture, fish health management, and post-harvest handling. Collaborate  with  project  partners,  government  agencies,  and  other  stakeholders  to facilitate access to resources, inputs, and services for fisherfolk, including credit, extension support, and market linkages. Monitor  and  evaluate  the  progress  of  the  FFPO  project,  collect  data,  and  prepare reports on project activities, outcomes, and impact. Provide  technical  support  and  advice  on  the  design  and  construction  of  fish  farms, hatcheries, and other infrastructure to support aquaculture production. Promote  gender-sensitive  approaches  and  ensure  the  active  participation  of  women and marginalized groups in fisheries-related activities and decision-making processes. Stay abreast of emerging trends, innovations, and best practices in the fisheries sector, and incorporate relevant knowledge and technologies into project interventions. Liaise  with  government  authorities,  regulatory  bodies,  and  research  institutions  to advocate  for  policy  reforms  and  investments  that  support  sustainable  fisheries management and aquaculture development. Perform  any  other  duties  as  assigned  by  the  project management  team  or  senior management. Screening  and  identification  for  new  business  prospects  and  work  on  project proposals.Preferred candidate profile Master's degree  or equivalent  in  Fisheries Science, Aquaculture, Marine  Biology,  or a related field. Our commitment to quality and sustainability has positioned us as leaders in our field. We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Manager of Procurement to join our team and drive our fresh fruits procurement and supply chain operations.Responsibilities:Procurement Strategy: Develop and execute procurement strategies for fresh fruits, ensuring cost-effectiveness, quality, and reliability of supply.Global Sourcing: Utilize hands-on experience in global sourcing to identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers worldwide.Supplier Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers, negotiating contracts, terms, and pricing to optimize value and mitigate risks.Quality Assurance: Collaborate with internal stakeholders to establish and maintain stringent quality standards for fresh fruits, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and customer expectations.Supply Chain Optimization: Continuously evaluate and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the fresh fruits supply chain, identifying opportunities for cost reduction, process improvement, and innovation.Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of procurement professionals, providing guidance, support, and development opportunities to foster growth and excellence.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams such as operations, logistics, finance, and sales to align procurement efforts with business objectives and ensure seamless integration across functions.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Agricultural Sciences, Horticulture, or related field. Advanced degree preferred.Minimum of 6 years of experience in procurement, with a focus on fresh fruits procurement and supply chain management.Proven track record of success in global sourcing, with experience in identifying and developing relationships with suppliers worldwide.Strong negotiation skills, with the ability to drive favourable terms and pricing agreements.In-depth knowledge of quality standards and regulatory requirements related to fresh fruits procurement.Excellent leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate team members to achieve their full potential.Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across functions and influence key stakeholders.Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.Immediate Joiner or Serving Notice Less Than 15 Days PreferredWe look forward to hearing from you!

column2: To establish global hub operation presence in AMEA with the new organizational setup; interface with the wider P&S community and Order Management teams to ensure transactional order execution complies with the Syngenta Hub concept.    To lead in driving efficiencies in hub operation processes and contribute to standardization and simplification. Act as senior Hub operation SME, in the area of operational escalation management, outsource partner service management.    To support the development and implementation of global projects, e.g. AMEA transformation, S4HANA, etc.      Accountabilities      Act as a lead of subject matter expert in Hub operation areas and build capability in SAP transactions to support standard hubbing and exceptional scenarios.    Outsourcing (Capgemini) service management and upholding the quality of Hub Operation services to customers.    People management and development for Hub Op team in AMEA region.    Collaborating with other team members in global hub operation, ensure consistency and accuracy of standard operating procedures for outsourced services and support process adherence reviews. Actively contribute to best practice exchange across the regions    Interface with key P&S stakeholders (including Logistics, Customs, Planning, Supply Chain Management, Direct Procurement) to foster cross-functional process understanding and transactional compliance with the Syngenta Hub concept.    Support the transactional design and implementation of new flows / projects (e.g. S4HANA)    Deliver continuous improvement projects, working with other members of global hub operation, EAME Order Management & & wider P&S teams to drive efficiencies in Intercompany processes.     Critical knowledge     Bachelor s degree in Business Management, supply chain or equivalent    Good understanding of Finance elements in Syngenta, particularly Transfer Pricing    Languages: English mandatory, additional languages are an asset    Good command of MS office and SAP     Critical experience     3-5 years of leadership experience in Customer Service & Order Management roles, experience in a hubbing setup will be of benefit.    Sound understanding of SAP order flows, intercompany processes and preferably experienced in a hubbing setup.    Experience in leading / contributing in cross-regional and cross-functional relationships and projects    Basic understanding of foreign trade     Critical technical, professional and personal capabilities     Ability to work in a cross functional and remote team (matrix organization)    Ability to quickly learn and apply new skills    Ability to map and work through complex business processes and assess options     Critical leadership capabilities     Manages for performance - taking ownership of actions and outcomes    Lead internal - mobilize the organization to create scalable solutions to deliver results    Courageous - acting decisively making trade-offs even in the face of uncertainty      Critical success factors & key challenges      A quick learner, a good team player who is good in collaboration and communication    Proactive and willing to take ownership.    Key challenges are mainly around good and quick grasp of complex global hubbing concept, process and operation. Learning curve will be steep

column2: Reporting to the Logistics And Warehouse Manager, the Assistant Logistics & Warehouse Manager will be responsible for coordinating logistics and transportation for our systems in the country.        You'll be in charge of:        You will be coordinating with Technical operations and sales team for supply and deliveries.     You will be preparing route plans for delivery of the products. Creating a network of local transporters by understanding the type and availability of the vehicles. Monitoring and Management of inventory and inventory movements across all warehouses     You will be handling invoices, customer contracts and product documentation.     You will be estimating and establishing cost parameters and budgets for purchases. Review and analyze all vendor/suppliers, their quality standard, delivery times and price options to negotiate the best deal for pricing and supply contracts.     You will be ensuring the warehouse operations at peak efficiency, by supervising, organizing, directing, and training warehouse employees and establishing, monitoring, and managing operation goals. Developing warehouse & Logistic operations systems by determining product handling and storage requirements, equipment utilization, inventory management, gate processes, and shipping.     You will be ensuring timely delivery of products to the required customer location with customer satisfaction being the primary goal.     You will be overseeing daily operations, while controlling and managing inventory and logistics.     You will be reviewing & ensuring workflow, manning and space requirements and action plans while ensuring quality and customer service standards are met at all warehouses.     You will be maintaining a safe and healthy work environment by establishing, following, and enforcing standards and procedures and complying with legal regulations. Complying with state, and local warehousing, material handling, and shipping requirements by studying existing and new legislation; enforcing adherence to requirements; advising management on needed actions.        Education:        Degree or Diploma of logistics, procurement or business.             Key Experiences & Skills        You have proficiency in inventory management and vendor coordination.     You have strong ability in team leadership and coordination, with an added advantage.     You have competent computer skills.     You have additional expertise in export management is advantageous

column2: Roles and Responsibilities1.  Inventory Management: Develop and implement inventory control procedures to ensure accurate stock levels.Monitor inventory levels and anticipate demand to avoid stock outs or overstock situations.Conduct regular stock counts and reconcile discrepancies.Utilize inventory management software systems to track stock movements and analyze trends.2. Procurement and Purchasing:  Identify and source suppliers for spare parts, equipment, and other store-related items.Negotiate prices, terms, and contracts with suppliers to ensure cost-effective procurement.Place orders for necessary items in a timely manner to maintain adequate stock levels.Evaluate supplier performance and make recommendations for improvements. 3. Storage and Warehousing:  Organize storage facilities to optimize space utilization and accessibility of items.Implement proper storage techniques to ensure the integrity and longevity of stored items.Maintain cleanliness and orderliness in the warehouse or store area.Implement safety protocols and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.4.  Shipping and Receiving: Coordinate the receiving of incoming shipments, inspecting for accuracy and quality.Prepare outgoing shipments, ensuring accurate picking, and packingArrange transportation for outgoing shipments and coordinate with logistics partners.Track shipments and resolve any issues related to delays or damages. 5. Team Management:  Delegate tasks and responsibilities effectively to ensure smooth operations.Provide ongoing feedback and performance evaluations to team members.Foster a positive work environment and promote teamwork and collaboration. 6. Budgeting and Cost Control:Develop and manage the departmental budget, including expenses for procurement, staffing, and maintenance.Identify opportunities for cost savings and process improvements.Monitor expenses and implement measures to control costs within budgetary constraints. 7. Documentation and Reporting:Maintain accurate records of inventory levels, transactions, and supplier information.Generate reports on inventory status, purchasing activities, and operational performance.Analyze data to identify trends, forecast demand, and make informed decisions. Overall, a Store and Spares Manager plays a critical role in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of a store or warehouse, facilitating the availability of necessary supplies and spare parts while minimizing costs and maximizing productivity. Desired Candidate Profile Education and Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in  supply chain management, logistics, engineering, or a related field. A master's degree may be preferred or beneficial.Relevant certifications in inventory management, supply chain, or warehouse management (e.g., APICS CPIM, CSCP) are often preferred.Experience:Proven experience in inventory management, procurement, and warehouse operations, preferably in a manufacturing, retail, or logistics environment.Demonstrated experience in managing spare parts inventory and understanding of spare parts management principles.Experience in using inventory management software systems and proficiency in Microsoft Excel or similar tools for data analysis.Skills:Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to effectively manage inventory levels, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.Excellent organizational and time management skills to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines.Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, for interacting with suppliers, team members, and other stakeholders.Leadership abilities to motivate and manage a team, delegate tasks, and foster a positive work environment.Negotiation skills to secure favorable terms and pricing with suppliers and vendors.Attention to detail to ensure accuracy in inventory counts, order processing, and documentation.Proficiency in using inventory management software and other relevant tools to streamline operations and improve efficiency.Knowledge:Comprehensive understanding of inventory control principles, including ABC analysis, cycle counting, and safety stock management.Knowledge of procurement processes, including supplier selection, negotiation, and contract management.Familiarity with warehouse management systems (WMS) and their functionalities.Understanding of relevant regulations and compliance requirements related to inventory management and warehouse operations.Personal Attributes:Proactive and self-motivated with a strong sense of initiative and drive for continuous improvement.Ability to work effectively under pressure in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.Strong leadership qualities with the ability to inspire and empower team members to achieve goals.Integrity and professionalism in dealing with confidential information, suppliers, and colleagues.Strong work ethic and commitment to delivering high-quality results.Flexibility and willingness to take on new challenges and learn new skills.

column2: The Production Supervisor is responsible for overseeing the manufacturing process to ensure efficient production and timely delivery of high-quality products. Responsibilities:     Manage and lead a team of production workers, including training, scheduling, and performance management.    Ensure adherence to production schedules and monitor workflow to optimize efficiency and productivity.    Collaborate with other departments, such as logistics and quality assurance, to coordinate production activities and resolve any issues that may arise.    Implement and enforce safety protocols and best practices to create a safe working environment for all production staff.    Monitor production equipment and machinery to ensure proper functioning; arrange for maintenance and repairs as needed.    Review and analyze production reports to identify trends, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement.    Provide ongoing training to production staff to enhance skills and knowledge, and ensure consistent quality output.    Maintain inventory levels of raw materials and finished products, coordinating with supply chain and procurement teams as necessary. Uphold company policies and procedures, and promote a positive and collaborative work culture.     Qualifications:     Bachelor's degree in Manufacturing, Engineering, Business, or a related field. Relevant experience may substitute for formal education.    Proven experience (3-5 years) in a production or manufacturing role, with at least 1-2 years in a supervisory or leadership position.    Strong understanding of production processes, equipment, and quality control standards.    Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to motivate and manage a diverse production team.    Problem-solving skills and the ability to make informed decisions under pressure.    Detail-oriented with a focus on maintaining high-quality standards and operational efficiency.    Proficiency in using production management software and tools.    Knowledge of lean manufacturing principles and continuous improvement methodologies is a plus. column2: A Senior Accountant Executive is a high-level accounting professional responsible for managing the financial operations of an organization. They oversee financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis, as well as the management of accounting staff.     Budgeting and Forecasting: Developing and managing budgets and financial forecasts, including identifying potential risks and opportunities.     Financial Analysis: Analyzing financial data to identify trends and patterns, and making recommendations for improving financial performance.     Accounting Management: Managing accounting staff and ensuring that financial transactions are recorded accurately and in a timely manner.     Compliance: Ensuring compliance with relevant accounting standards, regulations, and laws.     Auditing: Coordinating with internal and external auditors to ensure the accuracy of financial statements and compliance with audit requirements.     Process Improvement: Continuously reviewing and improving accounting processes and procedures to increase efficiency and accuracy.     Industry: Originating,Processing & Marketing Agro-commodities & food products, with a focus on Spices, Oil Seeds, Pulses, Cereals, Feeds, Herbs & Botanicals, Raisins and Foodstuffs.
